Ada Kabel Menjuntai Dekat Halte Tendean, Nyaris Kenai Bus TransJ
03 Nov 2019, 16:35 by Wilda HN
Jakarta - Instalasi kabel yang melintang dekat Halte TransJakarta Tendean memprihatinkan sekaligus membahayakan. Gap antara kabel dengan Bus TransJ terbilang tidak begitu jauh.
Pantauan di Jl Kapten Tendean, Jakarta Selatan, Minggu (3/11/2019) pukul 15.49 WIB, kabel-kabel ini menjuntai di arah putar balik menuju halte TransJ. Instalasi kabel ini bahkan menyentuh kolong flyover.
Bus TransJ menurunkan lajunya saat berputar balik menuju halte dan tampak nyaris mengenai kabel. Sementara arus lalu lintas di sekitar lokasi terpantau lancar.
Kondisi berbeda ada di ruas Jl Cikini Raya, Jakarta Pusat. Tidak lagi terlihat kabel-kabel menjuntai di sepanjang jalan.
Sebelumnya, Gubernur DKI Jakarta Anies Baswedan menyebut pemasangan kabel harus ada izinnya. Pihaknya di Pemprov DKI sudah beberapa kali melakukan operasi pemotongan kabel.
"Kabel-kabel itu ketika dipasang harus ada izin. Jadi kalau kabel tak ada izinnya ya bermasalah. Maka itu kalau mau masang harus ada izin dan itu juga yang kami sampaikan kepada perusahaan-perusahaan yang menyediakan jaringan fiber optik. Pemrov adalah pihak yang menegakkan aturan yang memiliki kemampuan untuk memberikan regulasi lalu penyedia jasa yang harus mengikuti aturan itu," kata Anies di Ancol, Jakarta Utara, Sabtu (14/9).

There's Dangling Cable Near Tendean Stop, Nearly Kenai TransJ Bus
Nov 3, 2019, 16:35 by Wilda HN
Jakarta - The transverse cable installation near the TransJakarta Tendean Bus Stop is both alarming and dangerous. The gap between the cable and TransJ Bus is not too far away.
Monitoring at Jl Kapten Tendean, South Jakarta, Sunday (11/03/2019) at 15.49 West Indonesia Time, these cables dangled in the direction of turning back towards the TransJ stop. This cable installation even touches under the flyover.
The TransJ bus lowers its speed as it turns back to the bus stop and looks almost like a cable. While the flow of traffic around the location is monitored smoothly.
Different conditions exist on the Jl Cikini Raya section, Central Jakarta. No longer visible cables dangling along the road.
Previously, DKI Jakarta Governor Anies Baswedan said that cabling must have a permit. His office in the DKI Jakarta Provincial Government has conducted several cable cutting operations.
"When the cable is installed there must be a permit. So if there is no permit the cable is problematic. So if you want to install it there must be a permit and that is also what we convey to companies that provide fiber optic networks. The provincial government is the party that enforces the rules which has the ability to provide regulations and then service providers must follow the rules, "Anies said in Ancol, North Jakarta, Saturday (9/14).
